intro: Spergularia anceps, commonly known as the pink sandplant, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, pink or red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in dune environments. It has a low, creeping growth habit with narrow, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water. Spergularia anceps plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes and is adapted to withstand harsh coastal conditions.
